main event: On 30 May 1952, a pilot and co-pilot observed a bright metallic-like object near the island of Ohshima, Japan, estimated to be at an altitude of 19,000 to 20,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was round in shape and motionless, observed from 1900 to 1930 hours., The co-pilot and engineer agreed the object was not a cloud or balloon., The pilot minimized the incident, thinking it was an unusual cloud formation., Intel Officer considered the report significant, noting the lengthy observation period by two crew members., The object disappeared rapidly without any visible means of propulsion.
witness description: pilot, co-pilot, and engineer from the 61st Troop Carrier Squadron
